channel.title: Firefox vs. Tor Browser fonts
channel.description:
Workstation: set to connect using the Tor before VPN method. Browser: firefox-esr. Problem: a certain language doesn't get displayed properly on Firefox (instead of the letters, I see squares with numbers).
I looked at https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Language - I think the KDE instructions are obsolete.
Searching elsewhere, I run `sudo apt-cache search firefox-esr-l10n`, found the package I need and installed it. It didn't change a thing. I also added the language as an alternative in the firefox preferences, no change. I've used the `dpkg-reconfigure locales` to add it to the system, didn't help. I added it as an input language, as explained in https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Keyboard_Layout (Probably unrelated). I could then switch to this language and type, but didn't help with my issue.
All that didn't get firefox to display the fonts correctly.
Then I launched Tor-Browser, and I found out it's ok there! it displays everything perfectly. Just not on firefox.
I then restored the workstation to its previous state, before all of the modifications above. None of them were necessary for Tor-Browser to do the trick. No modifications required. Works out of the box.
Looking for differences, I noticed Tor-Browser uses the Arimo font as default while firefox uses Dejavu serif.
Any idea how to make that work on firefox?
